children.subject: I took an online R1B at a community college over a regular semester. The R1B hardly took up any time for me. I didn't do most of the readings, and sometimes forgot to do the discussion requirements, and still passed the class. This may be different if you're taking the class in-person, in which case I'd say the added workload is just in commute/physical presence, not in effort. This advice is probably not applicable if you're looking to have a more enriching R1B experience and want to fully participate in the class instead of just passing it. I think it's possible to do both, having spoken to friends who took 61BL.

history.content: Depends on the R1B class but I doubt it'd be enough of a time suck to impact your grade in 61BL, which shouldn't be too bad.
I was thinking of fulfilling my R1B requirement over the summer at a community college while taking CS 61BL at Berkeley. Would it be possible to do this? Or is the CS 61BL workload too much?
history.subject: CS 61BL + R1B at a community college over the summer?
